We definitely enjoyed the nicely prepared meal without paying Las Vegas price at the celebrity-front restaurants on the strip.

I had been wanting to try the Barrymore for quite some time, so we finally decided to give it a try this weekend. First and foremost, this place is tiny! You will definitely want to make a reservation to ensure that you get a table. The dining room is small and kind of dark. The weird wallpaper does nothing but darken the place up even more. The ceiling is really cool and I think with a lighter wallpaper it would really showcase the awesome ceiling. 

Our meal started with the bread basket and we were not disappointed. The bacon raison bread was really delicious and the warm baguette slices were also a great touch. The parmesan crisps were also good, I even added a few to my pasta. 

I started with the Roasted Heirloom Beets and was so happy I did. I love a good beet salad and they have a great beet salad. The goat cheese fritter was a really inventive touch. Everything on the plate worked well together and I tried to savor every bite. My husband started with the lobster mac and cheese. I really liked that it was creamy, but I didn't really think the lobster added anything to the dish. 

My husband and I both chose specials for the night. I went with the pappardelle pasta with a pork belly ragu and escarole. The escarole added a nice bitter flavor and the pork ragu was very savory. The pasta was delicate and delicious. I was very happy with the dish and had enough to bring some home. My husband had a surf and turf special of a filet of bison and lobster tail. The bison was so tender and delicate, I really enjoyed the few bites I was able to steal.

No meal is complete without dessert, so we moved on to the creme brulee. The creme brulee was perfectly done and the spiced pears added such an amazing flavor, it really worked well. The oatmeal cookie ice cream didn't bring much to the dish, but it was still really yummy. I definitely want to eat all future creme brulee with spiced pears!

We were not disappointed with our meal and I would definitely head back to the Barrymore again...soon!

Worst dining experience of my life. Food was blah, took forever to come out. Horrible service and rude management and wayyyyy overpriced for what your getting. Basically just don't come here, you will be disappointed. I want to give this place zero star if I could.

I wish I could give this a 5+. First, the atmosphere is classic. Very upscale. Kind of a Frank Sinatra elegance. The bread was great! One of the varieties was a pretzel bread that was warm and fresh. Unusual and done right. We had the bone-in filet steak and we shared it. It melted in our mouths. We also had the mashed potatoes which were puréed with a lot of flavor. Their wine list is extensive and they had a wine advisor available to help with your selection. We left feeling satisfied without being overstuffed. It was the right amount of food with great flavor, so larger servings aren't always better. Wonderful experience

love love love this place.  you can see the bartender takes pride in his concoctions, which were delicious, by the way :) food was excellent.  service was impeccable.  compared to a lot of places on the strip, this is a BARGAIN.  total value for the money.  i can't wait to head back again. a hidden gem!

I'd be wanting to try this place the last few times I came to Vegas, but noone wanted to make the trip to the other end of the strip. We finally took the trip out and wow was it worth it. The steak was tender and flavorful and the prices were extremely reasonable. I highly recommend it

As others have said...it's in an off the strip location and the hotel is a little lack luster. But, the Barrymore provided a unique atmosphere and a solid meal and service. We were there on a Monday night a week ago at approx. 8:30pm. There was only one other party dining during the time we were there. The service was prompt, manager and wait staff frequently checked on us. The pretzel rolls were yummy, good combination of soft/salty. 

We started with the seafood platter and it was fresh, seafood seemed to be good quality. Ordered Caesar salads and while they were tasty, they seemed a little overdressed. For mains, we both had bone in ribeyes - they were great. Chargrilled and tender. The baked potatoes were tasty with sour cream, chives and bacon. Good pour on the wine. My only regret was that I was SO full, I had to forgo dessert.

This restaurant is located in a small hotel just off Las Vegas blvd. We were not aware of the existence of either the hotel or the restaurant as it is easy to miss. The restaurant is a bit small but with a nice a decor. 
For our appetizer we ordered the crab cake. We got one medium size crab-cake with a lot of meat.  The appetizer was very good.
For our main entree we ordered the Chilean sea bass and Leg of Lamb. The Chilean Sea Bass was just average, there was nothing special to it. The Leg of Lamb was also decent but not memorable. As a side we had the Cream Corn Lobster which was delicious. 
The service was also very slow, I was expecting a higher level of service.
Overall, the place is just ok. There were good dishes, but not all of them were up to standards. 
Note: The Barrymore has some small plates and drinks on happy hour until 7PM.

I was looking for a perfect restaurant for a romantic evening and the Barrymore was everything I wanted! Off the Strip, so you don't have to fight traffic to get there. Quiet, so you can have a romantic dinner without shouting to hear each other. The food - excellent! I would DEFINITELY go there again! GREAT place to take that special someone!

Fantastic experience! My husband and I made a dinner reservation, arrived a little early and got seated right away. Our server Israel was outstanding, as was all the staff. We skipped appetizers thinking we would get dessert, and ordered filets, and shared sides of cauliflower, and Brussels sprouts. I also ordered a passion fruit and Prosecco cocktail which was delicious...in fact it was difficult to choose a cocktail, the Girl Next Door martini with pickle stuffed olives was calling my name, but I had a few glasses of sparkling wine earlier in the evening and found it wise not to deviate. 

Our steaks came out perfectly medium rare, and the sides were excellent. I love roasted cauliflower and the pine nuts and raisins were a perfect touch. We ended up being too full for dessert, but the choices all looked delicious!

I loved the interior, really great place for date night or ladies night, the outdoor patio, while a little small, was super cute too. We both agreed we would be back, and add it to our list to take out of town guests. Excellent!

Dear Barrymore, 

I just met you last night, but I have to let you know about how I feel. At the very start of the evening you blew me away with your old-school-gone-chic-fun-and-funky vibe. Your taste in music is classic and exquisite - wooing me from the start with a soundtrack that includes Billie Holiday. From the plush velvet tuck and roll booths to the faux velvet flocked black and gold wallpaper you looked too cool for school, but your open and friendly attitude made even older folks like my husband and I totally feel welcomed. 

Our server, Israel, was FANTASTIC! Although he was pretty busy hopping from table to table, he took the time to talk to us about your history, the family that started the entire Block 16 restaurant group, recommend a bottle of wine from your sexy glass encased wine cellar and even call me by first name. Super attentive and always willing to enthusiastically rave about your food.  

After having a grilled octopus epiphany at Estiatorio Milos, I've been searching out other restaurants in town that have their own version.  In fact, doing a Yelp! search on "grilled octopus" is what brought me to you in the first place. The tantilizing tentacles came beautifully mounded in the center of the plate with papas bravas, topped with celery leaf and bordered with dots of spicy tomato and chorizo oil. You delectable devil you! The octopus was of a thicker cut than Milos', which made it a bit difficult to cut through, but was surprisingly soft and non-rubbery. As with all your wonderful dishes, it was a sum of its parts for sure.

Next up - your Roasted Black Cod with brandade fritter, creamed leeks and squid ink buerre. I don't know if I'm imagining things, but this seemed like you were subtly winking at me and flirting by showing off your sense of humor. Beautifully presented, each item on the plate was solid within itself - but eaten all together?  I definitely got a kind of deconstructed and elevated "fish and chips" vibe - mainly coming from the inclusion of the fritter. Oh Barrymore, you're so charming and witty.

We don't usually do dessert, but one glance at the menu we were once again seduced by your charms. Israel suggested the Creme Brulee with balsamic strawberries, basil lime sherbet and black pepper shortbread - which we went for.  Again, a sum of its parts - I wasn't sure how the basil-lime sherbet was going to work - but boy, does it ever. Acidic cool and redolent with basil up against the creamy sweetness of the brulee and the tanginess of strawberries - you've shown me how thrilling a terrific dessert can be. I'm ruined.

I'm sure you get a lot of love letters - and I don't expect to enter into a monogamous relationship or anything - but this one night stand was one for the ages. Thanks Barrymore!

It is very rare that my husband and I go to a new restaurant and both like it.  He is very hard to please and an extremely picky eater.  A friend recommended The Barrymore when I asked for good restaurants that were not overpriced.  We got just that.  The decor, food and service were all impeccable.  I highly recommend.

We were a party of 8 for my bachelorette's party on September 3rd. The process of making a reservation was greatly helped by the General Manager Kirk Perry, and our waiter - who's name I unfortunately didn't write down - was charming, attentive, and great throughout the evening. Service as well as food was simply outstanding.
This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas... Great atmosphere...great food (grilled octopus and rib eye for two are two of my faves!) - great wine list! You must come here for dinner!!
Love the atmosphere. Very classy. Cocktails are yumm. The food was good too

I wish i could actually give this place a better review. Food was good, but not great enough to have such bad service. It may very likely be the night I went, but no one seemed to apologize for long waits and missing our reservation for over 2 hours. Bar gets 5 starts though. Great wine by the glass list.

We brought a couple friends here who we thought would really enjoy the vibe. We'd been here once before and really enjoyed ourselves. Unfortunately for that evening, we were not notified that there would be a wedding that took over the entire dining room so we were seated in a little room off to the side of the bar.  Definitely a huge disappointment.

Service was also a very big let down.  Because our table was small, it did not have room for our wine bottles or water bottles.  They kept water in a chiller behind us and the wine in some hallway on one side of the room.  Water was filled slightly more often than the wine but towards the end when they got busy, we went thirsty.  Our wine glasses sat empty for long stretches.  Even when the snooty unhelpful manager dude would pass by, we'd still go thirsty.

So it appeared that they only had one server for that entire room which consisted of a party of 14, a couple two-tops and another 4 or so four-tops.  There were a couple bus boys bustling around but otherwise, after it got busier, we got ignored.

The food started out good (when it wasn't so busy).  We got the large seafood tower, king crab cocktail and lobster mac and cheese.  These items were pretty tasty and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves...happy that we were kicking off in good fashion.

Unfortunately, from there it was all downhill. Although our friends raved about their entrees (filet mignon rare and sea bass), hubby and I were not happy with ours.  I ordered the ribeye and hubby went with the NY strip.  After a bite of the steak, I thought something was off.  I put my finger on the steak and realized that it was barely warm.  Same for hubby's!  All our sides came and the sauteed mushrooms were cold.  Nothing else was really hot!!  Worse yet, our steaks were underseasoned and mine was so full of gristle I stopped eating it halfway through, feigning a full stomach.  Should we have paid double and gotten the "Reserve" steaks?!  At this point, I felt like they served us leftover wedding food.

By this time, I was worn out by how disappointing the evening had been.  It took us forever to get out of there...trying to find our server, get the check, get our cards run, etc. I didn't want to put up a fuss with our friends present but we could tell that towards the end, they too were also getting short on patience.

Frankly, I get the feeling they are struggling.  When we arrived, the Royal Resort was deserted.  Their hip lobby lounge had nary a soul hanging out on a Saturday night and the bar was emptied out, shut down which was a stark contrast to how lively it was when we last visited.  The hotel's decline may be affecting this place's business.  

Needless to say, I think we've seen The Barrymore for the last time.

Made a call to The Barrymore last week to see if a reservation was possible with very short notice. The young lady who answered the phone was very accommodating and set us up for dinner at 6:30 p.m.. Arrived early to have a pre-dinner cocktail and was met by a very friendly accommodating staff/bartender. From the bar it was on to the dining room which I found to have the ambiance/tone of cool "old" Las Vegas establishments of years past. Service attentive and not too pushy. Appetizers fabulous, foie gras, and tartare. The wine list good and reasonably priced. I was also impressed with the by the "glass" selection and it's  pricing, reasonable. On to the main fare. We were a party of three ladies and decided to share the bone in rib eye for "two". Our server was very accommodating with our "share" request. Once the main course arrived and tasting was done, I would say that the rib eye was one of the best steaks I have had in some time. The steak was huge with leftovers to take home after getting our fill at the table. Dessert of chocolate molten cake and we were set. All in all a great evening with an uber cool "old" Vegas feel. One note to management, your dining room music selection/ variety was some of the best I have heard in a restaurant. One comment being that the sound system seemed a little lacking the night we were there. One doesn't want dinner conversation overpowered by music, but thought I should give this observation a mention. Thank you The Barrymore, we will definitely be back. Cheers!

Everything was perfect the Caesar was fresh and light! The lobster Mac and cheese is a must you can see the lobster and the filet was tender and the perfect amount of seasoning. We went for restaurant week and was totally worth every cent! The desserts were creamy and I am so full. It was a perfect night to sit on the patio the mist made it cool but not overwhelming. I would recommend coming here again!

This place basically ruined my wedding. Let me tell you why.

I originally called in 3 weeks ago to make reservations for my party of 14 after our wedding. I had submitted my credit card authorization, requested dessert from the pastry chef (which i had no response on, but that's another story), and had told all my guests/limo the plan for the evening. Then comes the week of my wedding, as i'm scrambling to complete last minute errands and extremely stressed out. I receive a call on Monday, for my reservation that Saturday. Whomever calls me left a message to verify my reservation. I thought this was odd to call 4 days early, but figured it had to do with our large party. I returned the call to confirm, and the associate asked me if i got her message a week ago (i checked my voicemails and incoming calls and there was nothing) saying that they had a private party actually book last week (after we had made our reservation) and that we would now be seated outside for our reservations. Mind you, when i originally scheduled this, i made them WELL aware this was my wedding, aka my party will be in dresses and the low is on average 35 degrees in Las Vegas. She reassured me there would be a heater though so it's all good. 

Needless to say, i cancelled my reservation. I don't understand how The Barrymore would think it is legit to change someones reservation this way because someone else called in after me? i'm confused by this policy and extremely frustrated, as i am left to find a place to entertain my guests on my wedding night the week of my wedding. 

I find this place extremely disrespectful, and i will never attempt to give them my business again, although they clearly aren't too concerned with this notion.

The Barrymore is a small roomed restaurant that is for those looking for a cozy/romantic atmosphere.  The plush pale blue booths make it even more so.  The food is delicious, at it should be for the price.  My boyfriend and I both had steaks and enjoyed their extensive wine selection.  Its just a block off the strip in a very unassuming hotel, but the restaurant is worth going to.

I had dinner here with a large group of people so i was able to try many items. The food was very disappointing. Foie gras app was overcooked and so were my scallops. I ate one bite of my scallop entree and left hungry. The only redeeming quality of this restaurant is great cocktails and service.

This was our second time to the Barrymore in the past year and it was as fantastic as the first time.  The food is delicious, the staff is superb and The Barrymore drinks will knock you on your behind.  Pricey but worth it.

Great restaurant in Las Vegas. My steak was cooked perfectly, and the house-made sauces really brought out the flavor of the beef. The wine list was phenomenal. All of the sides were done well, including one that I would almost NEVER get, the brussel sprouts - delicious. 

Service was a solid B+. Our server was extremely formal in dress, demeanor, and verbiage, which I welcome - but maybe it was even a bit robotic for me. I love fine dining restaurants, but when I can't really connect to the server because the service feels forced, it becomes less desirable; and borderline uncomfortable.

The hotel that this restaurant is in was a serious turn off. It's an old, dusty, cheesy hotel. If you're coming here for a special occasion, I feel that some of the specialness may be lost when having to leave your car in the sad parking lot of the Royal Resort. Luckily, the interior of the restaurant is beautiful. Dark, comfortable, and romantic; with high booths and light background music for privacy. It really didn't match. I feel that the clientele of the hotel and the clientele of the restaurant would almost never overlap. Move this into the City Center, and that would be much more fitting.

Meal was between $150 and $200 for two of us, so it was more Strip-level pricing. Not sure if that makes a lot of sense to me. It felt a little overpriced due to the okay service and less-than-ideal location. 

60/40 chance of me revisiting.. But the steak was amazing.

An amazing gem hidden away from the craziness that is the strip. The restaurant has an equisite setting reminding you of the old 1940's of Las Vegas.

The ceiling is decorated with film reels, low lighting with a view of the wine tower which then goes on out to the bar/lounge area (and if you looked hard enough you could see out to the balcony where the fire pit was). The ink blot paintings on the wall were a treat to look at and although small, with a good group of friends made it just perfect.

Service here was truly jaw dropping, the friendliness of the staff and the attention to detail they provided for you is something to not over look, they take very good care of you.

Our food was delicious, everything was devoured and enjoyed bite by bite and I am excited to make my way back here very soon!

This restaurant is absolutely gorgeous. It's randomly located in an older hotel located right off of the strip. It almost has a speak-easy feel to it.. really cool. For the most part, the food is good. Appetizers were tasty and cooked perfectly. Our party got the shrimp cocktail, lobster mac and cheese, rock shrimp and the grilled octopus. All really amazing. Where the restaurant was lacking was the service and the quality of the entrees. Our steaks and fish were overly seasoned with salt, it almost rendered it inedible. We would have said something or perhaps sent it back if it didn't take an hour for our entrees to come out after we had finished appetizers. I've been to this place twice, and both times had an issue with the timing of the entrees coming out at a reasonable time. It's a shame because for the price, you want to be able to enjoy eating all of your food, but waiting for that long you begin to get full and lose your appetite from the appetizers expanding in your stomach:( The service was ridiculous. We had about 4-5 servers and all seemed to be on different pages. You'd think with that much help, that things would run a bit smoother than it did. And when we asked how much longer our entrees would take (this is at 40 minutes after our appetizers were removed), we got shot back with an attitude. Not ok at all. I've worked in the service industry for seven years, and it was very hard to keep my blood from boiling over when we were treated this way, especially since our check total came out to more than $1000! Overall, our dinner took a little over 3 hours, when it should have been over in 2. By the end of it all, we were absolutely exhausted and instead of going out to enjoy the night, we all were just ready to go home. Any-who, with that being said, I sadly will not be returning to this establishment. First time shame on you, second time shame on me. It is truly a shame because it really is a beautiful restaurant.

Carries well traditions of heavily french-sauced 80s, with many favorite perennials, prepared with surprising alterations. Desserts are a star attraction.

--Best macaroons in the world. I'd put them against the pastry chefs abroad. Light, perfectly formed, packed with flavor. The perfect bite to finish your delection.
--steaks personally salted by chef before serving. perfectly cooked.
--seared fois gras for the ages
--creamed spinach
--scallops with polenta and proper reduction. wow.

Not much to add here which hasn't already been said.

arriving at the Royal, i was nervous. Encore is visible just over the wall and the parking lot is empty. but step inside and you'll find some slightly odd design choices like the painted Yamaha grand in the lobby.
feeling inspired i sat to play, but it was so out of tune, didn't make it for more than a few seconds.

i love that the restaurant's entry door is as big and heavy as a bank vault door. cool.
so too go the chic treatments and lighting in the bar and dining room. very classy in a retro yet modern way. the clash of these styles is mesmerizing.
and all this without the throngs and sea of mouth breathers. so quiet and exclusive.

Came here for a large group dinner. Everyone unanimously loved the food, and the ambience fit in really well with our occasion. It has an old school vibe all over, especially in the beautiful tasteful decor.

Bit of a walk from the main Strip, but not too bad.

We returned to the Barrymore again this time.  The food is very good (warning, if you get the cold seafood platter, it's a bit skimpy - even with an appetizer and dessert - might want to go to the large portion even if there are only 2 of you).  Really great decor.  Such a hidden gem (the Royal Resort hotel is a simple, out of the way place).  

While the food is definitely good, it's the service that really grabs you at this place and pushes things to 5 stars.  My wife and I really enjoyed talking to the General Manager last Saturday night.  He was VERY attentive and made sure everything was perfect.  He even took back a whole bottle of wine just after we ordered it because it wasn't to our satisfaction.  

Small and quaint.  Just very different and a great place for couples.  Thank you, Barrymore.  Two for two!  Keep up the great work!

I came here on Sunday night without a reservation.  It was very quiet.  There was only my table and another table.  The server was very nice.  I went there to eat my favorite foie gras.  So I ordered a filet mignon with a size foie gras and beef bone marrow.  My husband also ordered the Chilean seabass.  The price is reasonable considering it is a high end restaurant in Vegas.  The filet was $43 plus $19 foie gras add on and $16 for two pieces of bone marrow with crusty bread.  The Chilean seabass was pretty soft and I thanked them for that!

I didn't get the Yelp check-in free wine because my husband and I don't drink but that's a tip for those of you do.  We asked for steak sauce and the server brought us three kinds of sauce in little containers.  But the server didn't let us know that there was extra charge for $5.   I think I would appreciate if I was told there is extra charge because you never know how much it would be.  

Overall the environment was okay and the food was decent.  The only thing I wish for is a bigger portion.  Especially that little piece of foie gras.  It was way too little.  I rather pay more to eat a bigger piece.

We wanted to try this place for over a year. Finally, we did.

Atmosphere: Very cool/different setting. I felt like I was almost eating dinner at Hogwarts (lol) or on a fancy train because of the setting.  Very small, intimate dining room and nice setting.

Food: The bread basket was amazing as they provided pretzel bread and a few other untraditional bread choices. Man, the pretzel bread/roll was amazing.  Caesar salad, scallops, pork belly, and lobster Mac n cheese appetizers were tasty (8.5 out of 10). The filet mignon was tasty once it was refired (will discuss below).  The lobster bisque was not as good as most I've had (7 out of 10). Everyone enjoyed their food and I was pleasantly full. The desserts were delicious and we sampled a few. 

Service:
The waiter we had was awful. The waiter refused to bring my wife her diet soda, me some lemons for my club soda, forgot to bring a bottle of wine to the table as requested, and failed to do the above numerous times.  Both of the steaks that were ordered were cooked two levels beyond what the requested and had to be re-ordered. With a dining room so intimate, there is no reason why the waitstaff could not be extremely attentive to the needs of the tables. The waiter that we had was completely ill-equipped and did not deserve to work there.  After requesting the manager and voicing all of our issues, we were given some free desserts. We were still very upset about the service we got as the desserts did not nearly make up for the terrible waiter.

The Bill:
This place seems to charge more than they should for what they are. It also seemed like they were trying to be a couple notches above the level of class that they were as far as plating of the food and quality of service was considered. The prices were way too high for what we received. We had four people in our party, ordered a bottle of sparkling water, a bottle of cheaper wine, two martinis, one soda, five or six appetizers, and three entrées. With a 10% tip, the bill came out to $380. 

Thankfully, we were in great company and had a blast talking and joking with our friends. We will not be returning to the Barrymore.

Went to see Mr. Joe Vento play piano at the Royal Resort. Decided to have a meal at The Barrymore. Lives up to its reputation as the spot to sit relax and have a delicious meal. I never gave 5 stars before. But our waitress Emily and our waiter Joseph made the meal even better with their excellent service. The meal was one of the best I've ever had on every level.

The most amazing place!!! Romantic, intimate and very "speakeasy-ish"...The staff was amazing and the managers floated all night to make sure everything that came out of the kitchen was to out liking...The food was amazing, everyone at our table had a different plate and there was no complaints :) If you really want to feel like you have an "in" to Vegas this is a place that should be visited!

We were in Vegas this past weekend and I did some research on some places I wanted to eat at. The Barrymore kept popping up and on our last night there, we were finally able to make it into this wonderful gem. 

Located off the strip, and in a less than glamorous hotel, the Barrymore is great escape for a romantic, intimate meal. The décor is dark, classy and very intimate. It's a great date spot for sure!

Here's what we ordered:

Appetizers:
Grilled Octopus ($16)- a MUST order! 
Caesar Salad ($12)

Entrées:
Chilean Sea Bass $(35)
The best Sea Bass, I have EVER had. Outstanding! 
NY Strip ($37)
Steak was cooked perfectly!

Cocktails:
Spring Lilly ($14)
The Barrymore ($13)

Dessert:
They made us a special espresso martini- so good! 

They made a mistake on our entrée order. My fiancé had ordered the NY Strip, and I think our server had written it down wrong because she brought out a filet. When we let her know that it wasn't what we had ordered, she sincerely apologized. They brought out a shrimp cocktail appetizer in the meantime so that he could have something to eat while he waited a bit longer for his steak. The shrimp cocktail was so good! The shrimps were HUGE and fresh! 

Two different managers came to our table to apologize for the mix up, which I found quite impressive. They brought us another round of drinks as well and when dessert time came, it was on the house. I was more than grateful and impressed at how they handled the situation. We weren't upset to begin with, but it definitely made all the difference in the world that they truly cared about our experience at the Barrymore.  

Overall, the BEST dinner place we visited in Las Vegas. Every time we visit Vegas now, the Barrymore is a must! It's on my top list for favorite places. 

They also have a great wine list. It's hard to decipher between ordering a cocktail or a bottle of wine since both options looked great! 

Thank you for your outstanding service, your amazing food, and just a wonderful experience on our last night. We will most definitely be returning every time we're in town.

Such a classy yet comforable dining room with the perfect mix of whimsy and old school masculinity: leather banquettes, Hollywood reels adorning the ceiling, rich damask wallpaper and plaid carpeting may seem too busy, but believe me, this space just draws you in and wraps its cozy arms around you like an old friend.

The food was perfectly portioned and seasoned. My beet salad with pistachio and goat cheese medallion was perfect for an appetizer. We shared the small plates among friends and not one complaint was murmured during the meal. Entree-wise, we ordered a great variety and The Barrymore delivered on every single dish.

You will not be disappointed!

The ambiance is to die for...like a hidden gem on the Vegas strip. The decor is very hip very cool very intimate...definitely a place I would recommend to bring friends for drinks and tapas. Not for dinner though, and I say this because 6 of us went there for dinner we all ordered different things and the consensus at the end of the night was...."meh at best". Halibut was under cooked and had no taste, rib eye was over cooked the chicken was dry and the short ribs definitely a bit salty with way too many carrots! 

We did order the lobster mac and cheese that everyone raves about, but again...meh and a bit salty. I did enjoy the watermelon salad but definitely something you don't want to share as the portion is really meant to be enjoyed by two at most.

Would I go back for drinks tapas and to socialize....most def, but not for dinner. Not really worth the price.

Sorry not a winnah winnah chicken dinnah this time.

Nice ambiance, decent priced menu, friendly waiters.

Came here for a work dinner after a long day working a trade show. We had the lobster mac & cheese and grilled octopus for appetizers, both were yummy but nothing I haven't had before. I decided to go with the duck for my main entree (had something similar at a wedding and it was DELICIOUS), but the one at Barrymore did not live up to my expectation :( Too dry and wasn't very flavorful, the sauce was too sweet.

We also got asparagus and mushroom on the side, both were okay.

They upgraded our wine selection for free, twice!! ---- nice enough for a 4 star review! :)

Went on a Monday night "industry night" we got half off thank god. The steak was certainly not worth the asking price. I got a ribeye that was. Itching but grissle. Sides were cold and the place wasn't busy. inside was very well decorated. Very comfortable

This restaurant is located in a very little know hotel with no casino near Encore. The decor of the Berrymore could be consider as classy and modern. The server was very knowledgable. We had Foie Gras and a Special Steak with Few others add on, They were absolutely delicious. I dare say that this place is better than some of the celebrity chef restaurant on the strip. I would totally recommend this place to anyone who love Steak and Foie Gras. I would definitely come back for more.

I love everything about the Barrymore.  I love the "Old Las Vegas meets Old Holywood" vibe.  I half expected to see Dean Martin or Frankie walk out from behind the flowing iridescent silver/grey curtains.  I love the movie reels on the ceiling, the mood lighting,  the high back, pintuck velvet booths, the pristIne white tablecloths and top notch service. This place is so romantic and oozes with glamour.

It was suggested that we request to be served by Israel and he did not disappoint.  rrom the wine recommendations, to the presentation of each course, to the scraping of the table between each course, he was a class act.

The food was fantastic. My husband is not a foodie but was very adventurous and loved every bite.  We had a yummy beet salad to start and our entree's were Chilean Sea Bass and Filet.  We shared the asparagus and mashed potatoes (I can honestly say that they were just average) but the entree's were worth every penny.  

We had dessert (I think it was Tiramisu) and again...delish.

So overall...I would agree with the other reviewers that this is probably one of the best kept secrets in Vegas and I would definitely go here again!  Word to the wise...leave the kiddo's at home..PLEASE!!

I hesitate to write such a glowing review because I don't want to share the great secret that is The Barrymore.  This off the strip steak house was outstanding.  It only has 10 tables which is perfect for a quiet, old-time Vegas experience.  As soon as we sat down, our server Danny and the sommelier Bryan tool great care of us recommending a bottle of wine that was excellent and well priced.  The steak was great, and the cream corn with lobster and bacon may be my new favorite side dish!  The entire experience was pure class and unlike much of Vegas, totally lacked pretense which is a welcomed relief.  We will absolutely recommend The Barrymore to others, and stop in next time we are back.  Many thanks to Danny, Joey, Bryan and Kerry for a wonderful dining experience.

Israel. He was a wonderful server and made our night absolutely exquisite. I hate to say it but he talked us into several menu items just by his knowledge of the way the items were cooked, what they were served with and how they were displayed. He knew what he was talking about and everything that came out was delicious. 

We ordered the lobster bisque, lobster mac and cheese, and pork belly to start. The bread basket was delicious as well. I enjoyed a Porn Star, while my husband ordered a Manhattan. Both drinks were delicious, but the Manhattan was so smooth we ordered two more. Israel recommended a wine that paired perfectly with my husbands meal.

On to the entrees! I ordered their special sea bass, while my husband picked the Rib-eye. My sea bass was a little fishy but the flavors surrounding the fish helped drown that out quite a bit. The asparagus was on point though! My husbands rib-eye looked amazing & according to him tasted amazing. 

All in all the best part of our dinner was the service. Thank you Israel for making our evening that much more special! We will definitely come back!

I chose The Barrymore after lots and lots of research for my group's "big dinner" during a bachelorette weekend in vegas. I could tell a few girls were skeptical of the location - off the strip and in a very low key hotel- but once we got inside I was blown away. Very 
old school Vegas vibe. It felt very intimate and our server Daniel was very sweet to us. The steak was cooked to perfection (get the sauteed spinach it's divine) and even added a round of shots on the house after dinner. All of us girls had a great time and will definitely be returning next time.

Okay...anyone who frequents Las Vegas knows that many of the very best chefs in the world have restaurants there. It is literally a city oozing with 5 star sauces. The problem is, many of the restaurants are jammed into smoky casinos, overpriced, and often focus on the show more than the food.  Sure...go to Switch once and watch in awe as the walls change and the roof rotates before your eyes.  It will be entertaining, and take your mind off the fact that you are about to get a $400 bill.  Everyone should experience it at least once. No pain no gain.

For those of you who consider a night "off the strip" somewhat of a victory however, I strongly  recommend that you give The Barrymore a try.  It does not have flashy dancers, crazy lasers, moving walls, ice sculptures, or celebrity chefs.  What it does have however, is old Vegas charm and...oh yeah...excellent food.  

The ambiance is more Lionel Barrymore than Drew Barrymore in almost every respect.  The dining room is warm and cozy with plush booths and a classy 40's-style movie motif.  One truly feels as if they might just look in the booth next to them and catch a glimpse of Bogey or Grant sipping on a cosmopolitan with a lady friend.  

The staff is great as well.  From the time we walked in and sat down, we received flawless service.  Our head waiter was dressed in a white dinner jacket and looked as if he could have just finished serving Lionel himself.  He was fully familiar with the dinner menu, bar specialties, and did not hesitate to offer his opinion on wine choices.   The evening manager also stopped by our table, introduced himself, and asked about our experience. 

We dined on NY Strip steak, braised short ribs, and a wonderful risotto. Each dish was well executed, top quality, and very enjoyable. The highlight was a wonderful roasted artichoke, which still haunts my taste buds two weeks later. 

So, if you are in Vegas looking for a flashy trendy restaurant named after some celebrity on the Food Network, you may be happier on the strip eating a $35 shrimp cocktail with the din of slot machines in the background.  If however, you are looking for a classy, elegant, dining experience with a real "old Vegas" feel.  Give The Barrymore a try.  The difference is black and white!

We booked The Barrymore for my husband's 50th birthday party sight unseen and based mostly on the yelp reviews and I have to say we were not disappointed at all! We had a group of 18 and every single one of our guests loved the restaurant, the food, the staff and the environment.  We worked closely with Chastity to book the reservation and make our menu choices and she was amazing! She was so helpful and made the evening run smoothly.  We loved The Barrymore, our night was perfect! Absolutely perfect!!!!

Good food and a surprisingly intimate venue at the quiet end of the strip. Well worth giving a try, kind of a little gem. I had the duck which was okay, the breast could have been more tender but the presentation was good and the taste was balanced.

Had dinner at Barrymore on my birthday.  Bottom line, food was just ok.  We ordered lobster mac & cheese it was watery and bland, foie gras is served like seared  whole chicken liver with sweet fruit and toasted almonds, it was just ok.  I ordered rib eye steak, it does not come with anything but plain steak, so my rib eye steak with veggie and bits of crab and steak sauce cost $75.00. The steaks was just ok.  My husband had the duck, the duck was just ok, it was a bit dry. My total bill with tip is $270.00 with 2 cup of coffee. Oh they gave me complementary cheese cake for my birthday with a candle.
The website claims that this place is unpretentious and welcoming...doesn't describe the place at all, complete opposite. Make sure you are well dressed and come with a heavy wallet.

My husband and I had dinner here the other night for our anniversary and it was amazing! I had no idea where or what the Royal Resort was and I was a little worried with I first pulled into the parking lot. When I walked into the lobby I felt like I had just found the best kept secret in Vegas. I LOVE the decor. So fun! It is my new favorite dinner spot. I can't wait to go back.

Good steak. Get the chilled seafood platter. Live singer with a nice voice. The venue is smaller but well done with an old Vegas feel.  I have been to Del Friscos, STK, Ruth Chris and Mortons in town and the Barrymore is as good or better,  and when comparing price Barrymore wins.

Had dinner here last night as I've been wanting to try this place out on my past few Vegas trips. Interior was definitely swanky, perfect for a date night. Restaurant was hidden just off the strip in a random hotel. 

On to the food... Appetizers were on the small side. Foie gras was tiny but tasty. I got the aged bone in filet which was awesome. My main complaint is that I felt a bit cheated. Waiter presented the filet as their special of the night but didn't disclose that they would charge you for all of the toppings.  By the time I got the bill I was surprised that I paid 85 dollars for a steak. 65 for the steak 17 for a topping and 3 dollars for some sauce on the steak. I don't mind paying for a good piece of steak but didn't appreciate the dishonesty. Don't get dooped on the special like me! 

Three star but I rated it two too offset all the false reviews.

Ok, so this restaurant is the epitome of "Don't judge a book by it's cover".  My husband took me here for dinner on our first night in Las Vegas.  At first I thought  we were lost or the restaurant had moved.  The Barrymore is located inside the Royal Resort which is a little off the main strip.  Upon walking into the hotel there was no one in sight other than one person behind the service desk that pointed us towards the direction of the restaurant.  Once we walked through the somewhat hidden door it was like we were taken back to a the 1940's when mobsters ruled Vegas.

Our server Luis was great and provided us with good recommendations.  We started off with Lobster mac & cheese.  They were are very generous with the lobster meat. My husband ordered the Bone-in Ribeye while I had their Chilean Sea bass and we ordered the Cream Corn Lobster and Roasted Cauliflower as our sides.  Ok, so I cannot stop raving about the amazing Chilean Sea bass.  It was melt-in-your-mouth spectacular and the simplicity of how it was prepared just let the flavor of the fish shine through.  I am a Cream Corn junkie and their Cream Corn Lobster did not disappoint at all.  We both polished off every dish we ordered.  For dessert we ordered their Guava Cheesecake which was the best ending to an unforgettable meal.  Then to end the night Luis brought us four of the cutest mini macaroons.  

I would definitely dine at The Barrymore again when we are in Vegas.

Im divided between a 4 stars and a 5 star.

I went with a party and i got a steak.  The $65 ribeye for 2 ppl.

The steak itself was OK.  I had better and I dont think its USDA prime.  I believe its USDA choice.  It was overcooked and I did let the waiters know and I was offered a replacement.  GIven I was with a party, I didnt want to hold up everyone so i ate it and they gave me a very small cheesecake as a replacement.

The steak itself (besides the overcooked part) was alright.  Nothing out of the ball park.  for $65 for 2 ppl servings (I shared with a friend), I expected a little bit more.  More like USDA Prime meat quality.  

They steak sauce is AMAZING! You should get the hordnaise sauce, im not spelling it right.  They have their Barrymore sauce too.

Friend had the VEGGIE CURRY.  Dont order, its blend and not tasty.

Other friend ordered New York steak i believe, its the other one.  Its alright too.

BUT,

they have AWESOME service! Totally a place to bring a date! Ambiance is awesome, small and cozy.  Waiter is attentive.  They CLEAN your table after you eat and take plates right away.  Take bread crumbs away and very attentive.  

Given the price, service and quality, I feel that 4 stars is what this restauant gets.  COme here for a good time, but not awesome food!

Here are my thoughts:  Made a reservation for a Sunday evening, got to the place and it was empty, really?  The steak we ordered was tasty and cooked just like we liked it. The cesar salad and lobster bisque where yummyyy, and also the complimentary bread, but the short ribs had to much fat and where a little burnt. I  Was not to crazy about the drinks either. So if you have extra cash give it a try and I hope your experience is much better than mine.

Excellent Dinner for 10 people.  The food was exceptional and the service was great.  We sat outside and even though it was very hot, they kept misters on that kept us cool.  Some in the group had steak, others had fish.  Some raved about the steak.  I had the fish.  It was all great.  The entire group had a good time.  I would not hesitate to go again.

The Barrymore had a great atmosphere. Very welcoming and friendly service. Food was delicious. Appetizer to start with was lobster mac and cheese and octopus. The octopus is a must! For dinner me and the family had salmon, sea bass, bone marrow, and rib eye 18 oz. marinated 28 days. All very tasty! Cocktails were well.

Amazing! Great atmosphere different from a typical night out 
in Vegas.Staff is friendly and can carry on a conversation. Cocktails are smart and food is even smarter! Love the watermelon and the frisée salad. Squash Couscous was excellent. Definitely coming back!

Had dinner at the Barrymore this week with my girlfriend and my parents. I had high expectations and also picked the place for the decor, looking v cool on the website. I really wanted to like the place.
I made a special request for a nicer table as we were celebrating my parents' wedding anniversary - The restaurant called a week before saying they made special arrangements and got us a nice table on the patio. Great! 
Well it turned out that the "special arrangement" was to accomodate a big group that took over the whole room on the night of our reservation. So nothing to do with my request, they just fooled us. 
The young lady who placed us was obnoxious and unpleasant. On the other hand, our waitress was really nice and helpful. 
I am putting 2 stars as the steaks we got (NY strip and T-bone) were very very good. The 35$ foie gras burger was a total disaster. 
Definitely not worth the 25$ ride from the strip and freezing on the patio most of the time.
Yum yum. Amazing food and excellent service. If you are in Vegas, this restaurant is a must. Intimate setting and only holds about 50 people. Make a reservation.

meat and salad ok but nothing special
vegetables overcooked
everything else not worth the time or money
other reviews very misleading

This was our first time at The Barrymore. I found it here on Yelp of course. We shall return. The food was excellent. We ordered grilled octopus, crab claws, duck con fit, grilled asparagus, and bone in rib-eye medium rare. The Barrymore cocktail was pretty good as well. 
Note: if you want a booth seating make reservations for 3 or more. If not you will be seating at a small table next to the window.
Oh my.....! What is this place doing in in location it is? What an amazing, gorgeous, fantastic restaurant. Food was amazing. Service was top notch. And the dessert was....wow!
